text:
F. H. LaGUARDIA, Mayor
M. S. NOVIK, Director
CITY OF NEW YORK
ADDRESS ALL
COMMUNICATIONS
TO THE DIRECTOR
MUNICIPAL BROADCASTING SYSTEM
MUNICIPAL BUILDING^ jj#y. ?
WORTH 2-5600
WNYC
January 14, 1944
Mr. Prank 2. Schooley
Executive Secretary
The Natl.Assn.of Educational Broadcasters
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Franks
thanks very much for your January 5th note.
I don't think anyone should have any objection about
asking ComriLssioner Studebaker to use his influence in order
to secure more FM frequencies. But how can we justify it with
the FCC if it is true that the educational stations have not
requested the frequencies, or aren't sufficiently interested^
I'd like to know about the educational interest because
I'm sure it will come up at the FM meeting to be held in New York
at the end of this month, and when it does, I'd want to have the
answers.
Sincerely yours.
Director
MSN:sd
168
'New York City's Own Station”—830 Kc.
